<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c63b72b6dc1347530ce906b462bb568994552c8b|patch 8.2.1508: not all debugger commands covered by tests>
patch 8.2.1508: not all debugger commands covered by tests

Problem:    Not all debugger commands covered by tests.
Solution:   Add tests for going up/down in the stack. (Ben Jackson,
            closes #6765)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1508: not all debugger commands covered by tests · vim/vim@c63b72b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1508: not all debugger commands covered by tests · vim/vim@c63b72b
attachments.text: Problem: Not all debugger commands covered by tests. Solution: Add tests for going up/down in the stack. (Ben Jackson, closes #6765)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/51b6eb47b3c41b01a5559b099e65354c8897093e|patch 8.2.1507: using malloc() directly>
patch 8.2.1507: using malloc() directly

Problem:    Using malloc() directly.
Solution:   Use ALLOC_ONE().  Remove superfluous typecast.  (Hussam al-Homsi,
            closes #6768)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1507: using malloc() directly · vim/vim@51b6eb4
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1507: using malloc() directly · vim/vim@51b6eb4
attachments.text: Problem: Using malloc() directly. Solution: Use ALLOC_ONE(). Remove superfluous typecast. (Hussam al-Homsi, closes #6768)

patch 8.2.1506: Vim9: no error when using a number other than 0 or 1 as bool

Problem:    Vim9: no error when using a number other than 0 or 1 as bool.
Solution:   Check the number is 0 or 1.

patch 8.2.1504: Vim9: white space checks are only done for a :def function

Problem:    Vim9: white space checks are only done for a :def function.
Solution:   Also do checks at the script level.  Adjust the name of a few
            error messages.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/81e17fbe00fd2ed93b262adc3ba41c86b02e7f46|patch 8.2.1503: Vim9: error for autocmd defined in :def in legacy script>
patch 8.2.1503: Vim9: error for autocmd defined in :def in legacy script

Problem:    Vim9: error for an autocmd defined in a :def function in legacy
            Vim script.
Solution:   Don't check the variable type. (closes #6758)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1503: Vim9: error for autocmd defined in :def in legacy script · vim/vim@81e17fb
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1503: Vim9: error for autocmd defined in :def in legacy script · vim/vim@81e17fb
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: error for an autocmd defined in a :def function in legacy Vim script. Solution: Don't check the variable type. (closes #6758)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3fc71285d5ae7c16cf7be5d997fd1fe140f196da|patch 8.2.1501: Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order>
patch 8.2.1501: Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order

Problem:    Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order.
Solution:   Generate constant before option, register and environment
            variable. (closes #6757)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1501: Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order · vim/vim@3fc7128
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1501: Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order · vim/vim@3fc7128
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: concatenating to constant reverses order. Solution: Generate constant before option, register and environment variable. (closes #6757)
